title: eCupid
description: This week, Chris Haigy, Drew McFadden and Eric Henke watched the 2011 romantic (?) comedy (?) eCupid, featuring a bunch of straight people trying to play gay, and Morgan Fairchild as a magical computer genie.
topics: Why gay movies can't seem to get kissing right
Bad boys, boy next door types, skaterboys and dirty, dirty fratboys

title: Going Down in La La Land
description: This week, the boys watched the 2011 film Going Down in La La Land, the almost certainly semi-autobiographical story of a reluctant pornstar who finds the love of America's favorite sitcom dad. Or, as it's described by Google "Friendships sustain people living in Hollywood and help them deal with the celebrity-obsessed culture."
topics: The films of Jet Set Men
Whether Chris got paid enough for posing nude

title: Eating Out
description: This week, we talked about the 2004 "sex comedy" Eating Out, which at the time was hailed as gay sexy fun. 2004 was a different time. A time of Blockbuster Video, flip phones, and questionable consent. A time when it was totally cool for men to get laid through trickery. A time when supposed allies were allowed to just make it rain gay slurs. Basically, I'm saying this movie hasn't aged well.
topics: What it meant to be early 2000's attractive
Which Doctor Who was the gayest

title: Vampire Boys
description: This week, Chris asked if we could watch the 2011 horror romance Vampire Boys, and like idiots we all said "I don't know what that is, but sure." With vampires who can go out in the sunlight, and aren't afraid of crosses, but do need the love of a mortal, it's a lot like a gay Twilight. A Twinklight, if you will.
topics: The porn that Chris pretends he doesn't watch

title: Kiss Me Kill Me
description: Hey all you cool cats and kittens, this week, we discussed the 2015 tiger-centric film Kiss Me Kill Me, a neo-noir Hollywood thrilller directed by two-time We Read Movies director Casper Andreas. When Dusty Young's rich fiance is murdered in what looks, to everyone but the characters in the movie, like a robbery gone wrong, he is blamed for the murder. Now, with the help of some sassy lesbians and a hypnotist drag queen, he'll have to find the real killer, clear his name and maybe find love along the way.
topics: How soon after your fiance is murdered is TOO soon to start a new relationship
Chris takes a break from describing the plot of this movie to describe the plot of a porno

title: Kaboom
description: This week, we talked about Greg Araki's 2010 psycho-sci-fi-sex-dramedy Kaboom. Look, I don't know how to describe this movie to you, it's crazy. Someone sees a murder, there's a lesbian witch and a doomsday cult and some very gross mac and cheese.
topics: What kind of dickpics we'd like to receive in our inbox (wereadmovies@gmail.com)
How big a cock you'd need to gag three people with it at the same time
The proper way to eat pussy like it's spaghetti

title: Another Gay Movie
description: This week, we talked about another gay movie, specifically, the gay movie Another Gay Movie, a parody of the raunchy screwball sex comedies (ike American Pie). Has it aged well? Does it go way too far in the raunchy direction? Why does Drew keep defending it? WHY?!
topics: How many is too many poop jokes?
Whether quiche is even any good
Seriously, why does Drew like this movie?

title: SHORTS - Hey, Google
description: We're trying something new today! We noticed a glut of bad gay short films on our streaming services, and decided, on our off weeks, that maybe we'd talk briefly about those. So if an hour and a half of us yammering in your ears every two weeks just isn't enough, now you can hear us talk for twenty more minutes about a short film it only takes ten minutes to watch.
topics: How soon is too soon for a pandemic related story?
Why you probably shouldn't make a movie that makes the watcher's smart device chime every 30 seconds

title: The 10 Year Plan
description: Best friends (who don't seem to actually like each other very much) Myles and Brody make a pact that they'll be boyfriends if they're still single in 10 years in this JC Calciano entry from 2014. It's your typical rom-com setup, but will there be a twist this time? Does the fact that it's not funny or romantic count?
topics: What should and should not go inside the human body
The amazingness that is the movie Scoob

title: SHORTS - Legally Blonde
description: This week, for our bonus short, we begin by talking about Chris in the shower, and end up talking about that scene in Legally Blonde where Enrique the poolboy gets outed for knowing about designer shoes. It's a wild ride.

title: Bear City
description: This week, the boys watched the 2010 film Bear City, a hairy, gay attempt at Sex and the City, that Chris has a lot of opinions about. Can a twink make it in bear's world? Can a bear make it in a twink's world? What if neither of those classifications applied and it was just a boring romantic comedy without jokes? Let's find out!

title: SHORTS - David Decoteau
description: This week, we answered the question of why we'll never do a David Decoteau movie on this podcast.
topics: Sorority Babes in the Slimeball Bowl-o-rama
Who the killer was this whole time

title: Eating Out 2: Sloppy Seconds
description: This week, we were joined by the incomparable Mike Johnson and Kyle Getz from the Gayish podcast to talk about the 2006 film Eating Out 2: Sloppy Seconds. Scream taught us that, in the sequel, the body count is always higher, the death scenes are always more elaborate, and the killer is never dead. Will those rules hold true to this tale of sexual trickery? Let's find out!
topics: What your grandfather's balls can tell you about your future
How to make models comfortable when posing for homoerotic art

title: Hot Guys With Guns
description: This week, fighting through technical difficulties, we talked about the 2013 film Hot Guys With Guns, about two ex boyfriends and wannabe private eyes who solve the crime of who robbed a bunch of Hollywood sex parties. The title is promising, can it live up to it? Probably not!
topics: The right way to commit crimes

title: SHORTS - Mulan
description: This week, we talked about the Disney animated movie Mulan, maybe you've heard of it?
topics: The use of fruit in drag

title: The Big Gay Musical
description: This week, at the request of a fan, we watched the misnamed 2009 movie The Big Gay Musical, a movie that is pretty small and not really a musical. What's going on here? It must be the work of none other than Casper Andreas.
topics: The beauty of men's ballet tights

title: SHORTS - Flamingo Pride
description: This week, we found a computer animated short called Flamingo Pride which is... bonkers. Join us as we lose our fucking minds trying to talk about it.
topics: Why geese deserve to be in jail

title: Last Ferry
description: This week, we watched the most recent movie we've done, the 2019 film Last Ferry. When a young gay lawyer sees a murder on Fire Island, he pretty much ignores it until the last five minutes of the movie when the movie goes off the rails. Fun!
topics: Hey, did you know that Chris is from New York?

title: SHORTS - Bed Buddies
description: This week, we watched the 2016 short film Bed Buddies, about what happens when best friends Brent, Jared and Danny all have a drunken threesome. Now in the cold light of sobriety they have to decide whether to stay friends or more than friends, and they have to do it while staring at Brent's comically gargantuan bulge.
topics: What slurs you're allowed to use (if in doubt, don't)

title: My Brother's Shoes
description: This week, we talked about My Brother's Shoes, a wacky body-swap comedy where two brothers swap bodies and learn a little lesson about how hard it is to pump a baby into your ovulating sister-in-law when you're a gay guy inhabiting your straight brother's body.
topics: A certain drag race alum's Nazi porn past
Freaky Friday body swaps vs Quantum Leap body swaps
Why it's so hard to get gay sex right in a gay movie

title: SHORTS - The More The Scarier
description: This week, for the spookiest month of them all, we watched a gay horror short about a horny ghost. It's only a 6 minute short, and most of that is laugh track, so most of the episode is us talking about whether or not we'd fuck a ghost.

title: Hellbent
description: The spookiest month continues with Hellbent, a 2004 gay slasher flick, about a hot guy in a devil mask who murders West Hollywood gays for... some reason. Did we lose our heads for this gorefest, or were we bored to death? Find out!
topics: We try to name a single opera
What's the best way to describe your dick?
Is it hard to get laid in drag

title: I Was a Teenage Werebear (with Sean Paul Lockhart, aka Brent Corrigan)
description: This week, we were joined by the incomparable Sean Paul Lockhart (Brent Corrigan if you're nasty) to talk about the 2011 featurette I Was a Teenage Werebear. A movie he was in! Guys, I'm geeking out over here.
topics: And we get real about some stuff

title: Pornography: A Thriller
description: This week, we talked about Pornography: A Thriller, a 2010 movie that wants you to feel bad about watching porn, but also kind of wants to show you some porn. The movie makes no sense, so if this episode feels incomprehensible, it's because we're actually doing an amazingly good job explaining it.
topics: How to get out of an unwanted party invitation

title: Third Man Out
description: This week, we watched Third Man Out, the first of the Donald Strachey mystery series produced for HereTV. Starring Chad Allen as the most famous gay private investigator in all of Albany, this movie is the fun kind of incomprehensible.
topics: Batman's claim to be the World's Greatest Detective

title: SHORTS - G O'Clock
description: This week, we talked for a very long time about the short film G O'Clock, about a chemsex party gone awry. Well, more awry.

title: Is It Just Me?
description: This week, we watched Is It Just Me? the first film by JC Calciano, and by far his worst. When sad sack Blaine finds out that he accidentally catfished Texas boy Xander, he'll have to reenact the movie The Truth About Cats and Dogs (but with a self-hating gay twist) if he wants to get the guy. Is love more important than looks? What if you're actually totally fine looking, and also if you've only known each other for like a day and a half?
topics: Why do people in movies play video games so fucking weird?

title: Walk a Mile in My Pradas
description: This week, we watched the 2011 movie Walk a Mile in My Pradas, about a straight guy who magically becomes gay thanks to Bruce Vilanch's magical Christmas ornament. Also there's a gay dude who becomes magically straight, but he's barely in the movie sooooo...
topics: The gay porn parody of The Ring

title: SHORTS - Luber
description: This week, we talked about the short gay film Luber, an exploration into the extreme depths of sadness, lust, and one man's parasite-filled butthole.
topics: Tattoos and the men who love them (Drew)

title: Midnight Kiss
description: This week, we watched Midnight Kiss, a Blumhouse presents horror movie about the dangers of kissing people on New Year's Eve, starring Captain America's brother, Scott Evans.
topics: Why Hulu is bad for seeing dong
Why does Eric think people keep condoms in the bathroom?

title: SHORTS - Andy The Talking Hedgehog
description: This week, at the suggestion of a listener who hates us, we watched the not even gay movie Andy the Talking Hedgehog. Starring Tara Reid and Dean Cain, this movie is a fascinating look into the depths of how bad a movie can actually be. We thought Pornography: A Thriller was terrible, but Andy the Talking Hedgehog has shown us how good we've actually had it. At least that movie hung dong.
topics: What should a talking cat sound like?

title: The Love Patient
description: This week, we talked about the 2011 movie The Love Patient, about an awful man who fakes having cancer to get back with his ex who's in a much better place since they broke up. Will deception bring love? Will they land the big client at their ad agency? Will there be a weird pagan orgy in the middle for some reason? Let's find out!
topics: Which Pokemon would you have sex with?
What exactly is the replicator on Star Trek using to make food?
The right way to pretend you have cancer for love and profit

title: Another Gay Sequel: Gays Gone Wild
description: This week, Isabel Anderson, who also does our amazing episode art, joined us to talk about Another Gay Sequel: Gays Gone Wild. All of us, except Drew, hated the first film, but what will this installment bring? Can it hope to surpass the nasty, crass humor of the first movie? (Hint: Yes)
topics: Which kind of merperson would you have sex with?
Chris describes the worst porno he's ever seen

title: Vampire Boys 2: The New Brood
description: This week, along with our special guests Butch Alice and Anya Knees, we talked about the 2013 film Vampire Boys 2: The New Brood. With naked fight scenes, bad accents, and mind control powers, it should be a hit. Is it? Probably not, but let's find out!

title: SHORTS - Do We Really Have To Say Goodbye?
description: This week, we talked about the short film Do We Really Have to Say Goodbye, a gay covid tale with a twist ending that's so short we padded it out with a list of movies Chris has cried at on planes. It's weirder than you think.
topics: Movies Chris has cried at on planes
Speaking of planes, who gave Baloo the Bear flight technology?

title: Judas Kiss
description: This week, we watched the 2011 time travel drama Judas Kiss. When failed director Zach agrees to judge a film competition at his old alma mater, he magically travels back in time and meets himself as a student. Does he have sex with himself? You bet he does. Does anything else happen? Let's find out!
topics: Would you have sex with past you?
How many time travel references can we make? Hint: it's a lot

title: SHORTS - Jackplot
description: This week, we watched the 2020 British short film Jackplot. For a movie with the word plot in the title, there's not a lot of it, so mostly we just talked about a DC/Frasier crossover. Join us, won't you?
topics: How much money would it take for you to kill your husband?
What if it was in British money?
What even is British money? How does it work?

title: Shock to the System
description: This week, we watched the 2006 Shock to the System, the second in the Donald Strachey series of mysteries. Join us as we return to the Dirty Albs, and try solve a mystery so confusing that the country's most famous gay detective doesn't even know what the mystery is.
topics: Chris describes a porno he should have described last episode

title: The Wolves of Kromer
description: This week, we watched the 1998 film The Wolves of Kromer. In a world where gay people are some sort of werewolves who live in the British countryside and eat old ladies, can we ever learn to get along with our straight neighbors? If this concept sounds wild, it's because it is.
